channel.title: Last Day - NEW & UPDATE
channel.description: All NEW and UPDATE articles from the last day with enhanced metadata

item.title: NEW: Urgent Patch for Actively Exploited WSUS Zero-Day!
item.description:
Headline: Urgent Patch for Actively Exploited WSUS Zero-Day!

Summary:
Microsoft has released an emergency out-of-band security update for a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Windows Server Update Services (WSUS), tracked as CVE-2025-59287. The flaw, which can be exploited by an unauthenticated attacker, is being actively used in attacks, leading the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) to add it to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog. A compromise of a WSUS server could grant attackers a powerful foothold within an enterprise network, enabling widespread lateral movement and subsequent attacks. Administrators are urged to apply the patch immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Microsoft releases an emergency out-of-band patch for CVE-2025-59287, a critical RCE vulnerability in WSUS that is being actively exploited, posing a severe risk to enterprise networks.

Article Slug: critical-wsus-zero-day-cve-2025-59287-actively-exploited

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Massive Prosper Breach Exposes SSNs of 17.6M Users
item.description:
Headline: Massive Prosper Breach Exposes SSNs of 17.6M Users

Summary:
Peer-to-peer lending platform Prosper Marketplace has disclosed a massive data breach affecting 17.6 million individuals. The incident, detected on September 2, 2025, involved an unauthorized third party gaining direct access to company databases and exfiltrating a vast trove of sensitive personal and financial data. The stolen information includes full names, Social Security numbers, government-issued IDs, income levels, and IP addresses, placing millions of users at significant risk of identity theft and sophisticated phishing attacks.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Phishing

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Peer-to-peer lender Prosper Marketplace suffers a massive data breach impacting 17.6 million users, with sensitive data like Social Security numbers stolen.

Article Slug: prosper-marketplace-data-breach-impacts-17-million-users

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Iranian APT 'Phoenix' Backdoor Hits 100+ Governments
item.description:
Headline: Iranian APT 'Phoenix' Backdoor Hits 100+ Governments

Summary:
A cyber-espionage campaign attributed to an Iranian-linked Advanced Persistent Threat (APT) group has compromised over 100 government institutions worldwide. The attackers are utilizing a custom, multi-stage backdoor dubbed 'Phoenix' to achieve their objectives. Initial access is gained through a mix of credential spraying and spear-phishing. Once inside, the Phoenix backdoor is used to conduct reconnaissance, escalate privileges, and establish long-term persistence for intelligence gathering operations.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Malware

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A sophisticated cyber-espionage campaign by an Iranian-linked APT group uses a new backdoor called 'Phoenix' to target over 100 government institutions worldwide.

Article Slug: iranian-apt-deploys-phoenix-backdoor-against-government-targets

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: 'Jingle Thief' Group Steals Gift Cards via Cloud & M365
item.description:
Headline: 'Jingle Thief' Group Steals Gift Cards via Cloud & M365

Summary:
A financially motivated cybercriminal group dubbed 'Jingle Thief' is actively targeting retail and consumer services companies in a campaign focused on large-scale gift card fraud. According to research from Unit 42, the group gains initial access via credential harvesting from phishing and smishing attacks. They then pivot to the victim's cloud environment, specifically Microsoft 365, to move laterally, find gift card issuance systems, and establish persistence by registering rogue authenticator applications. The campaign highlights a growing trend of abusing legitimate cloud services for financial crime.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cloud Security, Cyberattack

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A cybercriminal group named 'Jingle Thief' is targeting retail and consumer services companies by exploiting their cloud and Microsoft 365 environments to commit large-scale gift card fraud.

Article Slug: jingle-thief-hackers-exploit-cloud-for-gift-card-fraud

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Google Patches 6th Actively Exploited Chrome Zero-Day of 2025
item.description:
Headline: Google Patches 6th Actively Exploited Chrome Zero-Day of 2025

Summary:
Google has issued an emergency security update for its Chrome web browser to address CVE-2025-10585, a high-severity type confusion vulnerability in the V8 JavaScript engine. This marks the sixth time in 2025 that Google has patched a Chrome zero-day vulnerability that was being actively exploited in the wild. The flaw could allow an attacker to achieve arbitrary code execution on a victim's machine by tricking them into visiting a malicious website. All users of Chrome and other Chromium-based browsers are urged to update immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Google has patched CVE-2025-10585, the sixth actively exploited zero-day vulnerability in Chrome this year, which is a high-severity type confusion flaw in the V8 JavaScript engine.

Article Slug: google-patches-sixth-actively-exploited-chrome-zero-day-cve-2025-10585

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Agenda Ransomware Evolves, Hits Critical Infrastructure
item.description:
Headline: Agenda Ransomware Evolves, Hits Critical Infrastructure

Summary:
The Agenda ransomware group, also known as Qilin, is escalating its attacks by targeting critical infrastructure sectors with evolved tactics. According to research from Trend Micro, the ransomware-as-a-service (RaaS) operation is using a cross-platform approach, abusing legitimate remote management tools and deploying Linux-based ransomware on Windows hosts to evade security. The group also employs Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver (BYOVD) attacks to neutralize endpoint defenses and steals backup credentials to hinder recovery, primarily targeting high-value organizations in the U.S., Canada, and the U.K.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Industrial Control Systems

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Agenda (Qilin) ransomware group is evolving its tactics to attack critical infrastructure, using legitimate tools and cross-platform techniques to bypass security.

Article Slug: agenda-qilin-ransomware-abuses-legit-tools-targets-critical-infrastructure

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Tengu Ransomware Hits Brazilian Education Provider
item.description:
Headline: Tengu Ransomware Hits Brazilian Education Provider

Summary:
The Tengu ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack against UniCursos, a prominent education provider in Brazil. The attack, which was posted to the group's leak site on October 23, 2025, follows the common double-extortion model, where the attackers threaten to publish sensitive stolen data if their ransom demands are not met. The incident highlights the continued targeting of the education sector by ransomware gangs, who view them as valuable targets due to the sensitive student and staff data they hold.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: The Tengu ransomware group has claimed responsibility for a cyberattack on the Brazilian education provider UniCursos, threatening to leak stolen data.

Article Slug: tengu-ransomware-claims-attack-on-brazilian-education-provider-unicursos

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Ransomware Hits Jewett-Cameron, Steals Financial Data
item.description:
Headline: Ransomware Hits Jewett-Cameron, Steals Financial Data

Summary:
Jewett-Cameron, an Oregon-based manufacturing and distribution company, has confirmed in an SEC filing that it suffered a ransomware attack on October 15, 2025. The attack caused significant disruption to its business operations and resulted in the theft of sensitive corporate data. The exfiltrated information reportedly includes IT and financial data being prepared for the company's upcoming Form 10-K filing, as well as screen captures from video meetings. The unidentified attackers have demanded a ransom and threatened to leak the stolen material.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Data Breach, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Oregon-based manufacturer Jewett-Cameron confirms a ransomware attack disrupted its operations and led to the theft of sensitive financial data intended for an SEC filing.

Article Slug: jewett-cameron-operations-disrupted-by-ransomware-attack

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Lawsuit Hits SC School District After Ransomware Breach
item.description:
Headline: Lawsuit Hits SC School District After Ransomware Breach

Summary:
South Carolina's Lexington-Richland School District 5 (LR5) is facing a class-action lawsuit following a ransomware attack in June 2025 that exposed the personally identifiable information (PII) of over 31,000 students, staff, and alumni. The lawsuit alleges that the school district was negligent in protecting sensitive data and violated state law by failing to provide timely and complete notification of the breach. The compromised data included names, birthdates, Social Security numbers, and financial files, making it one of the most significant breaches for an educational institution in the region.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Ransomware, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Lexington-Richland School District 5 in South Carolina is facing a class-action lawsuit after a ransomware attack exposed the personal data of over 31,000 individuals.

Article Slug: lawsuit-filed-against-south-carolina-school-district-after-ransomware-attack

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Lazarus Group's 'Operation DreamJob' Targets EU Drone-Makers
item.description:
Headline: Lazarus Group's 'Operation DreamJob' Targets EU Drone-Makers

Summary:
The notorious North Korea-linked APT group, Lazarus, is conducting a cyber-espionage campaign dubbed 'Operation DreamJob' targeting European defense and aerospace companies. The campaign specifically focuses on firms involved in Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (UAV) technology. The attackers use sophisticated social engineering, creating fake recruiter profiles and job offers to lure employees. The ultimate goal is to compromise the target's network to steal sensitive intellectual property related to advanced drone technology.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

Article Type: Analysis

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The North Korean Lazarus APT group is targeting European defense and drone companies in a new cyber-espionage campaign dubbed 'Operation DreamJob' that uses fake job offers as a lure.

Article Slug: north-korean-lazarus-group-targets-european-drone-companies

Published Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Critical RCE Flaw in WSUS Allows Unauthenticated SYSTEM Takeover
item.description:
Headline: Critical RCE Flaw in WSUS Allows Unauthenticated SYSTEM Takeover

Summary:
A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2025-59287, with a CVSS score of 9.8, has been discovered in Microsoft's Windows Server Update Services (WSUS). The flaw allows an unauthenticated attacker on the same network to gain SYSTEM-level privileges on a vulnerable server by sending a maliciously crafted cookie. The vulnerability stems from an unsafe deserialization process. While not yet exploited in the wild, Microsoft rates exploitation as "more likely." Given that compromising WSUS could enable an attacker to distribute malicious updates across an entire enterprise, immediate patching is strongly advised.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: Advisory

Meta Description: A critical remote code execution vulnerability, CVE-2025-59287 (CVSS 9.8), in Microsoft WSUS allows unauthenticated attackers to gain SYSTEM privileges. Immediate patching is required.

Article Slug: critical-rce-flaw-cve-2025-59287-in-windows-server-update-services

Published Date: Sun, 19 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Sun, 19 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Massive Prosper Data Breach Exposes Social Security Numbers of 17.6 Million Users
item.description:
Headline: Massive Prosper Data Breach Exposes Social Security Numbers of 17.6 Million Users

Summary:
The peer-to-peer lending platform Prosper has confirmed a catastrophic data breach compromising the sensitive personally identifiable information (PII) of approximately 17.6 million people. The exposed data includes full names, physical addresses, IP addresses, income levels, and, most critically, Social Security numbers. The breach, first detected in September 2025, places millions of individuals at severe risk of identity theft and sophisticated financial fraud.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Data Breach, Phishing, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 7 minutes

Meta Description: Peer-to-peer lending platform Prosper has suffered a major data breach exposing the PII, including Social Security numbers, of 17.6 million individuals.

Article Slug: prosper-lending-data-breach-affects-17-million

Published Date: Mon, 20 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Mon, 20 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

item.title: UPDATE: Iran's MuddyWater APT Targets 100+ Governments with Phoenix Backdoor
item.description:
Headline: Iran's MuddyWater APT Targets 100+ Governments with Phoenix Backdoor

Summary:
The Iranian state-sponsored threat group MuddyWater is conducting a large-scale cyber-espionage campaign targeting over 100 government entities, primarily in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA). According to Group-IB, the attackers are using phishing emails sent from a compromised mailbox, leveraging the NordVPN service for anonymity. The emails contain malicious Word documents that use macros to deploy version 4 of the 'Phoenix' backdoor, a payload designed for foreign intelligence gathering. The campaign highlights the group's return to classic macro-based attack vectors.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Cyberattack, Phishing

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The Iranian APT group MuddyWater is targeting over 100 government entities in the MENA region with a new cyber-espionage campaign deploying the Phoenix v4 backdoor via phishing and malicious macros.

Article Slug: iran-linked-muddywater-apt-targets-governments-with-phoenix-backdoor

Published Date: Wed, 22 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 22 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Unit 42 Exposes 'Smishing Deluge' from China and 'Jingle Thief' Gift Card Fraud
item.description:
Headline: Unit 42 Exposes 'Smishing Deluge' from China and 'Jingle Thief' Gift Card Fraud

Summary:
Researchers at Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 have detailed two distinct and significant cybercrime operations. The first, a massive smishing campaign dubbed 'The Smishing Deluge,' is attributed to a China-based threat actor and is flooding mobile users globally with malicious SMS messages. The second campaign, named 'Jingle Thief,' is a sophisticated cloud-based operation focused on automating the theft and monetization of gift cards. These findings, highlighted in Unit 42's October Threat Bulletin, showcase the diverse tactics of modern criminals, from large-scale social engineering to highly targeted financial fraud.

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Threat Intelligence, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Palo Alto Networks' Unit 42 has exposed 'The Smishing Deluge,' a global SMS phishing campaign from China, and 'Jingle Thief,' a separate cloud-based operation that automates gift card fraud.

Article Slug: palo-alto-networks-uncovers-smishing-and-gift-card-fraud-campaigns

Published Date: Thu, 23 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Thu, 23 Oct 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Fri, 24 Oct 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded
